cards.title: Emergency DBA Access
cards.summary: Finance database patch is blocked. The app owner asks for direct root on production now.
cards.details: Change ticket exists but does not include a rollback plan or approval chain.

Approve.result: Patch starts quickly, but your audit trail is weak and risk exposure jumps.

Deny.result: You hold the line, but operations escalates the outage to leadership.

Investigate.result: You verify scope, require rollback notes, and issue time-boxed access.

Escalate.result: CAB lead approves guarded access with logging, but momentum slows.

cards.title: Shared Admin Account
cards.summary: A team requests one shared admin credential for overnight support.
cards.details: They claim rotation overhead is slowing incident response.

Approve.result: Support is faster, but accountability disappears across shifts.

Deny.result: You enforce identity-bound access and push teams to adapt.

Investigate.result: You stand up pooled JIT roles with per-user attribution.

Escalate.result: Architecture review confirms your concerns and funds automation.

cards.title: Intern Needs Production Logs
cards.summary: An intern asks for full production log access to debug latency.
cards.details: Logs include customer identifiers and privileged traces.

Approve.result: Debugging improves, but data minimization controls are bypassed.

Deny.result: You block access and the issue resolution slows down.

Investigate.result: You provide redacted scoped logs and preserve response speed.

Escalate.result: Team lead pairs with intern under monitored session controls.

cards.title: Contractor Offboarding Gap
cards.summary: A contractor left last week, but the account is still active.
cards.details: Procurement says paperwork is not complete yet.

Approve.result: Work continuity remains, but your insider risk spikes.

Deny.result: Account is disabled immediately; project manager is furious.

Investigate.result: You isolate privileges, force credential reset, and keep limited access.

Escalate.result: Legal and HR align offboarding controls with security policy.

cards.title: Developer Wants Permanent Sudo
cards.summary: A lead engineer requests permanent sudo to avoid ticket wait times.
cards.details: They are critical to a launch scheduled this week.

Approve.result: Delivery is fast, but least-privilege controls degrade.

Deny.result: You reject standing access and engineering pushes back hard.

Investigate.result: You grant just-in-time sudo with policy-based expiry.

Escalate.result: Security committee approves temporary exception with safeguards.

cards.title: Vendor Demands Direct VPN
cards.summary: A new vendor wants unrestricted VPN access for appliance tuning.
cards.details: Their statement of work does not mention segmentation requirements.

Approve.result: Vendor starts quickly, but network blast radius expands.

Deny.result: You block unrestricted paths and delay onboarding.

Investigate.result: You isolate vendor access through brokered sessions and MFA.

Escalate.result: Procurement updates SOW language to enforce secure access clauses.

cards.title: Audit Evidence Due in 2 Hours
cards.summary: Internal audit requests session logs and approval records immediately.
cards.details: The reporting pipeline is partially manual this quarter.

Approve.result: You rush incomplete evidence and spend the day in follow-up calls.

Deny.result: Audit is unhappy and opens a formal finding.

Investigate.result: You provide defensible partial evidence and schedule validated supplements.

Escalate.result: Leadership allocates support staff to complete the control package.

cards.title: Compliance Exception Request
cards.summary: Product asks for a 90-day exception to credential rotation policy.
cards.details: Legacy integration cannot tolerate current rotation frequency.

Approve.result: Delivery timeline holds, but compensating controls are missing.

Deny.result: You refuse exception and release schedule slips.

Investigate.result: You issue a short exception with monitoring and remediation milestones.

Escalate.result: Risk committee documents exception ownership and exit criteria.

cards.title: Third-Party Script Execution
cards.summary: Vendor support asks to run unsigned scripts on a privileged jump host.
cards.details: They insist this is standard troubleshooting procedure.

Approve.result: Issue may clear, but you create a severe code execution pathway.

Deny.result: You block execution and request signed artifacts.

Investigate.result: You isolate the script in sandbox and run static checks first.

Escalate.result: Security architecture approves a controlled, monitored runbook.

cards.title: Executive Demo Credentials
cards.summary: Marketing wants admin credentials in a live sales demo tomorrow.
cards.details: They need broad visibility to impress a large prospect.

Approve.result: Demo shines, but privileged credentials are now overexposed.

Deny.result: You block risky access and absorb political fallout.

Investigate.result: You provision a read-only demo tenant with expiring tokens.

Escalate.result: Leadership signs off on a controlled exception playbook.

cards.title: Suspicious Login Burst
cards.summary: SIEM flags privileged logins from two countries within six minutes.
cards.details: One session belongs to a known admin on travel.

Approve.result: You allow sessions to continue and potential compromise deepens.

Deny.result: You cut access fast and disrupt legitimate maintenance activity.

Investigate.result: You isolate sessions, confirm travel context, and rotate credentials.

Escalate.result: IR lead mobilizes full response and communications plan.

cards.title: Endpoint EDR Disabled
cards.summary: An ops server suddenly reports EDR disabled under a privileged account.
cards.details: The owner says this was needed for performance testing.

Approve.result: Performance test runs, but blind spots open across detection coverage.

Deny.result: You force protection re-enable and delay benchmark output.

Investigate.result: You validate request legitimacy and enforce temporary exclusion controls.

Escalate.result: Security and platform teams align on a controlled exception path.

cards.title: Ransom Note on Test VM
cards.summary: A non-production VM displays ransom indicators after a script run.
cards.details: No customer data is confirmed impacted yet.

Approve.result: You treat it as noise and miss early containment opportunities.

Deny.result: You shut broad systems down and overcorrect containment scope.

Investigate.result: You isolate host, preserve evidence, and prevent lateral movement.

Escalate.result: CSIRT engagement speeds triage and legal communication posture.

cards.title: SOC Wants All Admin Sessions Paused
cards.summary: SOC asks for immediate freeze on privileged sessions during investigation.
cards.details: Critical patch deployment is running right now.

Approve.result: Threat exposure drops, but deployment interruption causes outages.

Deny.result: Operations continue, but SOC loses confidence in containment.

Investigate.result: You apply selective freezes for high-risk sessions only.

Escalate.result: Joint incident command sets an approved freeze matrix.

cards.title: Credential Dump Artifact
cards.summary: Forensics finds a tool output suggesting partial credential dumping.
cards.details: The artifact timestamp overlaps with a maintenance window.

Approve.result: You dismiss it and retain potentially compromised secrets.

Deny.result: You rotate everything immediately and trigger major disruption.

Investigate.result: You stage targeted rotation and validate compromise indicators first.

Escalate.result: Executive incident review approves enterprise-wide response thresholds.

cards.title: Late Friday Firewall Rule
cards.summary: Network team requests broad allow-list change before weekend release.
cards.details: Testing evidence is partial and rollback is vague.

Approve.result: Release proceeds, but segmentation posture weakens significantly.

Deny.result: You reject incomplete change and own the launch delay.

Investigate.result: You constrain scope to approved subnets with explicit rollback.

Escalate.result: CAB signs a narrowed emergency change with controls.

cards.title: Unpatched Legacy System
cards.summary: A legacy host cannot patch due to vendor lock-in.
cards.details: It still handles privileged automation jobs nightly.

Approve.result: Jobs continue, but exploit exposure remains unmitigated.

Deny.result: You shut it down and disrupt a core operational workflow.

Investigate.result: You isolate host, add compensating controls, and plan migration.

Escalate.result: Risk acceptance is documented with funded remediation timeline.

cards.title: CI Pipeline Secret Exposed
cards.summary: A build log reveals a plaintext API secret from a failed job.
cards.details: The team requests delaying rotation until after release.

Approve.result: Release remains smooth while exposed secrets stay active.

Deny.result: You force immediate rotation and create deployment churn.

Investigate.result: You rotate in staged waves and patch log retention controls.

Escalate.result: Release leadership agrees on secure stop-the-line threshold.

cards.title: Break-Glass Account Untested
cards.summary: Disaster recovery review finds break-glass credentials untested for 8 months.
cards.details: The system owner argues there is no immediate risk.

Approve.result: You defer testing and retain uncertainty for real incidents.

Deny.result: You require immediate validation and disrupt planned sprint work.

Investigate.result: You run controlled validation and document a recurring cadence.

Escalate.result: Leadership mandates quarterly break-glass readiness drills.

cards.title: Privileged Session Recording Outage
cards.summary: Session recording service fails during peak maintenance activity.
cards.details: Teams request temporary bypass until storage is repaired.

Approve.result: Work continues but forensic visibility is temporarily blind.

Deny.result: You halt privileged operations and miss maintenance deadlines.

Investigate.result: You allow limited sessions with parallel command logging controls.

Escalate.result: Incident manager approves staged bypass with strict approvals.

cards.title: Board Meeting Demo Access
cards.summary: Leadership wants live privileged workflows shown in a board meeting.
cards.details: Security review was never scheduled for the demo environment.

Approve.result: Executive confidence rises while privileged patterns are exposed.

Deny.result: You prevent risky optics but trigger political pushback.

Investigate.result: You provide a sanitized simulation with least-privilege constraints.

Escalate.result: CISO sets board demo guardrails and approved narrative.

cards.title: M&A Due Diligence Rush
cards.summary: Potential acquisition requires rapid cross-domain admin visibility.
cards.details: The deal team wants broad access granted tonight.

Approve.result: Deal speed improves, but separation-of-duties controls collapse.

Deny.result: You enforce boundaries and become the bottleneck narrative.

Investigate.result: You issue scoped read access through monitored data rooms.

Escalate.result: General counsel signs temporary controls with audit coverage.

cards.title: Public Incident Disclosure Draft
cards.summary: Comms asks if they can claim no privileged misuse occurred.
cards.details: Investigation is still in progress with open indicators.

Approve.result: Statement lands cleanly now, but credibility risk compounds later.

Deny.result: You block premature claims and face communications pressure.

Investigate.result: You provide qualified language tied to confirmed evidence only.

Escalate.result: Legal, security, and comms align on defensible disclosure language.

cards.title: Talent Retention Exception
cards.summary: A key architect threatens to leave unless granted permanent elevated rights.
cards.details: Manager wants an immediate exception signed by security.

Approve.result: Retention risk falls, but privilege creep accelerates.

Deny.result: You protect policy integrity and trigger management conflict.

Investigate.result: You design role-based temporary elevation tied to project milestones.

Escalate.result: HR and leadership codify retention controls with risk ownership.

cards.title: Final Control Maturity Review
cards.summary: Quarter-end review asks whether PAM controls are production-grade yet.
cards.details: Evidence is strong but some workflows still rely on manual checks.

Approve.result: Leadership gets a confident message, but technical debt is understated.

Deny.result: You highlight gaps directly and invite hard planning conversations.

Investigate.result: You present maturity scores with concrete remediation roadmap.

Escalate.result: Executive steering group commits funding and timeline alignment.
